definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
first tone in Mandarin/high, level tone
(of singers etc) one answering the other
with a crash/with a thunderous noise

sentences.chinese: 我很气，叫了他一声“死纳粹”。

sentences.english: There was a long time when he wrote his own music without saying one word.
sentences.chinese: 有好长一段时间他写自己的音乐，一声也不吭。

sentences.english: At this moment the cannon of the harbor is heard firing, and Suzuki hurries in, saying that it is a warship.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时港口一声炮响，铃木跑进来说是一艘军舰。

sentences.english: A gun shot suddenly pealed forth and shot its flames into the air.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声炮响，一道火光升上天空。

sentences.english: But the way , have you seen Mr Zang . our manager ?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一声，你见到我们的张经理吗？
这些人排成一列排队一声不吭地出发了。

sentences.english: You should send a message to your family, maybe they are looking forward to it!
sentences.chinese: 给您的家人报一声平安，或许他们正在翘首企盼。

sentences.english: The Crow set up a loud caw and dropped the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸦张嘴大叫了一声，把肉掉了。

sentences.english: Following the roar, out rushed a lion from among the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声吼叫，呼地从树林里窜出一只狮子来。

sentences.english: It tumbled down through the bleeding tree and landed at our feet with a thud.
sentences.chinese: 它从满是树脂的树上跌下来，砰的一声落在我们脚前。
理查兹对着步话机大吼一声。

sentences.english: He broke off the twig with a snap.
sentences.chinese: 他啪地一声把那根树枝折断了。

sentences.english: My skin crawled when I heard a sudden shriek in the dead of night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚万籁俱寂时突然听到一声尖叫，吓得我汗毛直竖。

sentences.english: A bird thumped against the window.
sentences.chinese: 一只鸟儿咚的一声撞在窗上。

sentences.english: The whip swished through the air.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子嗖地一声在空中挥动。

sentences.english: He snorted indignantly and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 他气愤地哼了一声，走开了。

definition: yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
